The backup system must be located on an independent server, and the amount of available memory must correspond to the frequency of backup.
The performance and stability of the application in the cluster depends on the disk speed. A slow disk will increase the latency of requests in the cluster and potentially damage the stability of the cluster.
System software
The platform can be deployed on the
Postgre SQL 13
DBMS through the following operating system:
Linux Debian (ver. >= 11)
;
In addition, the Low-Code platform is available on other Linux distributions (Ubuntu, CentOS, etc.), but it is recommended to use the Debian Linux platform.
Network requirements
Type of network
Specifications
Network between the application server
The minimum undivided bandwidth of the connection channel to the System is 512 Kbit/s
Communication channels between servers
The minimum undivided bandwidth of connection channels between servers is 1 GB/s
Client software
The platform supports the 3 latest released versions of browsers:
Google Chrome
;
Safari
;
Firefox
;
Edge
.
It is recommended to use the Google Chrome browser
Technical support applies to the 3 latest released versions of the browser. For example, if the latest version of the Google Chrome browser is 109, then the platform supports 107, 108, 109 browser versions.
The chrome://accessibility flags should be turned off.
Interface requirements
To work with the System, a full-featured browser with the following settings is required (usually active by default):
JavaScript execution is allowed;
the use of cookies is allowed;
SSL encryption of traffic is supported (HTTPS is allowed).
